conclusion: To determine collision time, analyze the velocity-time graph.
The y-axis represents velocity in m/s, and the x-axis represents time in seconds. Car A starts at 25 m/s and decelerates. Car B starts at 15 m/s and decelerates.
Car A's velocity decreases from 25 m/s to 0 m/s. Car B's velocity decreases from 15 m/s to 0 m/s. Both cars stop at 30 seconds.
Calculate deceleration for Car A: -5/6 m/s² and for Car B: -0.5 m/s².
Calculate distance traveled by Car A: 375 m and Car B: 225 m using the area under the graph.
Determine relative distance: Car A travels 150 m more than Car B.
Analyze collision point: Car A's velocity is higher at 20 seconds, indicating it is closing the gap.
Conclusion: Collision occurs before 20 seconds as Car A is still reducing the gap.
